intro: Securinega hallii, commonly known as the Mexican spurge, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a rough texture, while its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds. Securinega hallii is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
